data.title: Shakira Announces First Tour Since 2018 With A Stop In Chicago This Year
data.meta_description: Grammy Award-winning global superstar Shakira will be coming to Chicago for a show at the United Center this year.
data.text:
Chicago has an array of incredible events to look forward to this year, ranging from beloved annual experiences like parades and food markets to music festivals and one-off live concerts.

When it comes to the latter, we’re lucky enough to live in a city that attracts some of the most famous musicians and performers on the planet and now “the Queen of Latin Music” herself has announced a show in Chicago later this year.

Grammy-winning artist, Shakira, this week announced a new tour “Las Mujeres Ya No Lloran World Tour” named after her twelfth studio album which was released last month making it the first since El Dorado in 2017.

The tour will take her across North America, starting in Palm Desert in California and making a total of 14 stops with a penultimate stop at Chicago’s United Center on Saturday, December 14th, 2024 before wrapping up in Detroit, Michigan the following day.

It’s the first time the best-selling female Latin artist of all time has been on tour since her 2018 El Dorado World Tour took her across Europe, Asia, North America and Latin America in in support of her eleventh studio album.

According to her website, tickets go on general sale on Monday, April 22nd at 10 a.m. local time but there is a special artist pre-sale event at 10 a.m. on Friday, April 19th which fans must sign up for before midnight Wednesday, April 17th.

Here are the full list of tour stops:

Acrisure Arena in Palm Desert, CA on Saturday, November 2nd

Footprint Center in Phoenix, AZ on Thursday, November 7th

Kia Forum in Los Angeles, CA on Saturday, November 9th

Frost Bank Center in San Antonio, TX on Saturday, November 16th

American Airlines Center in Dallas, TX on Sunday, November 17th

Spectrum Center in Charlotte, NC on Saturday, November 23rd

Capital One Arena in Washington, DC on Monday, November 25th

Scotiabank Arena in Toronto, ON on Saturday, November 30th

Barclays Center in Brooklyn, NY on Thursday, December 5th

TD Garden in Boston, MA on Sunday, December 8th

Bell Centre in Montreal, QC on Tuesday, December 10th

United Center in Chicago, IL on Saturday, December 14th

Little Caesars in Arena Detroit, MI on Sunday, December 15th
